text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode

I love guacamole let me think you
already ingredients so you can get
started you're gonna use some avocados
some fresh cilantro lime some scallions
or green onions whatever you call them a
jalapeno and some salt so there are so
many different variations of guacamole I
mean I know a lot of places like to put

onions I personally don't like white
onions in this because I think they're
so strong and for me personally it's
putting a tomatoes and guacamole is a
major nono because tomatoes have so much
moisture and liquid in them that as it
sits with the avocado mixture it splits
you see all the liquid around the edges
and I don't like that I like a smooth
creamy guacamole and this is my recipe
that I love and then I use all the time
and I wouldn't change a thing about it
but you can certainly put tomatoes and
white onions in it if you prefer that so
there you go let's get to it you want to
use good quality avocados this is Hass
avocados and you want to make sure that
they are nice and ripe because a hard
avocado is just not gonna work for this
at all so here's what I'm gonna do I'm
gonna cut the avocado in half like so
there you go and then I just take a
spoon and take all the flesh out of the
avocado and this is why it's so
important that the avocado is nice and
ripe now some people take the stone
outwards the path or whatever you want
to call it with a knife you can
certainly do that you twist and there
goes but this can be really dangerous
because that now is very very slippery
and I don't want to touch that so what
I'm gonna suggest you do is you take it

pop it and then you just start working
around it you see that because if you do

really dangerous and it's not good
another tip that someone told me once
put one stone or one pit in the

Brown
do you know that I didn't know that so I

so I'm actually gonna take it out for

I like it a little on the chunky side so

so that's finely chopped for me I kind

avocados really need a lot of salt
